name: leaper
description: `Tab` to jump out of autoclosing pairs like braces and quotes.

leaper.decorateAll.markdownDescription:
If `true`, will decorate all detected pairs. 

If `false`, will only decorate the detected pairs nearest to each cursor.

leaper.detectedPairs.markdownDescription:
The autoclosing pairs to detect. 

Note that there is no support for pairs that are more than 1 character wide on either side, so `(())`, for instance, is disallowed.

leaper.decorationOptions.markdownDescription:
Specify how the closing side of each pair is decorated. 

Note: 

- With the exception of `rangeBehavior`, all of vscode's [`DecorationRenderOptions`](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#DecorationRenderOptions) can be specified. However, options aside from the `outline`, `border` and `font`-related ones have not been tested, and may therefore introduce unwanted side-effects when used. 

- Any options that require a non-`string` type can be specified with an object literal. For example, see the default value of this setting, where a [`ThemeColor`](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#ThemeColor) is specified for the `outlineColor` property. 

- Decorations can be disabled by configuring this setting to `{}`.

leaper.decorateOnlyNearestPair.markdownDescription: ~~If `false`, will decorate all pairs instead of just the nearest one.~~
leaper.decorateOnlyNearestPair.deprecationMessage:
DEPRECATED since 0.7.0 

This configuration was renamed to `leaper.decorateAll` for clarity.

leaper.additionalTriggerPairs.$comment: This deprecated configuration has no default value in the package manifest. The default value was previously hardcoded in source code.
leaper.additionalTriggerPairs.markdownDescription: ~~Set additional pairs that the extension will detect. Currently there is no support for pairs that are more than 1 character wide on each side.~~
leaper.additionalTriggerPairs.deprecationMessage:
DEPRECATED since 0.7.0 

This configuration was deprecated in favour of `leaper.detectedPairs`, as the newer configuration allows for the specification of pairs in a simpler format. Furthermore, it allows users to disable detection of the default set of pairs. Previously, the default set of pairs was hardcoded and could not be changed.

leaper.customDecorationOptions.$comment: This deprecated configuration has no default value in the package manifest. The default value was previously hardcoded in source code.
leaper.customDecorationOptions.markdownDescription: ~~Customize the decoration of the closing character of the pair.~~
leaper.customDecorationOptions.deprecationMessage:
DEPRECATED since 0.7.0 

This configuration was renamed to `leaper.decorationOptions` for clarity.
